unidue.ub.statistics.admin

Class NotationDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • org.mycore.frontend.servlets.MCRServlet
          • unidue.ub.statistics.frontend.FachRefServlet
            • unidue.ub.statistics.admin.NotationDAO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig, org.quartz.Job

    @WebServlet(value="/admin/buildNotationIndex")
public class NotationDAO
extends FachRefServlet
implements org.quartz.Job
    Builds an index of notations to allow retrieval of regions by JPA queries.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Eike Spielberg
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getNotationsList

        public static java.util.List<Notation> getNotationsList(java.lang.String notations)
        retrieves a list of Notation-objects from the index of notations. The notations may have different notations as well as regions, separated by ',' and '-' , respectively.
        Parameters:
        notations - a string containing the first and last notation, separated by a '-'
        Returns:
        notationsFound a list of Notation objects.

      • getNotationsList

        public static java.util.List<Notation> getNotationsList(java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> notationsRange)
        retrieves a list of Notation-objects from the index of notations.
        Parameters:
        notationsRange - a Hashtable containing the first ('von') and the last notation ('bis')
        Returns:
        notationsFound a list of Notation objects

      • buildIndexfromGHBSYS

        public void buildIndexfromGHBSYS()
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 org.jdom2.JDOMException
        reads in the notations from a list of systematik.xml files and builds the corresponding index.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception while reading systematik.xml file from disk
        org.jdom2.JDOMException - exception upon parsing the systematik.xml file
